lexUnit.name: gaunt.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: lean and haggard, especially through suffering, hunger, or age.

sentence.text: This is what the gaunt , red-eyed old lady had told them ; and of course Charsky , needing to draw close in some way to his dead father , wanted to try it out .
Yes , Dorothy was rather thin , even gaunt .
Nowadays he 's gaunt and interesting . "
Eliot was " tall , gaunt , of pallid hue and tensely withdrawn from anything reminiscent of the flesh " .
He was also gaunt and cadaverous , and as dark as the Semitic people of the Holy Land .
The rescue team leader , Terry Doe , said : ` He was emaciated , very gaunt , with sunken eyes , very hungry and very cold and wet .
The gaunt figure reeled , clutching at the doorframe for support .
As Wycliffe left the house he looked back and saw the gaunt figure still at the window .
The gaunt figures strode ever onwards .

Although highly sexed and eager to make the acquaintance of nubile young ladies , Neville 's gaunt , stooping figure , with its slightly effeminate affectations , had attracted the attention of quite the wrong sort of person .
He smiled hopefully at the gaunt man beside him .
Gaunt men emerge from doorways , and proceed , swinging rolled umbrellas down the street .
The gaunt man with a snarl in his Canadian voice said , ` You said before Winnipeg , and I 've done it and I want my money . "
The gaunt woman did not return the merry smile he offered in greeting .
The gaunt woman hurled his plastic pistol after him .
The gaunt woman glared round at him .
The gaunt , grey-haired sergeant fixes me with a studiously suspicious look and takes a note of my name and the time .
Mr Dakin 's gaunt frame carried little flesh but the grossly thickened fingers bore testimony to a life of toil .
Philip Pesaro looked gaunt .
She insisted on sharing it with Annunziata , who looked even more gaunt than she had done before the news of her son 's survival , and then got up .
She did not look so gaunt and old , and her lips were red and full , and curved , like a smile but not quite a smile .
